meanings.definition: The act of making something more potent or powerful.
meanings.sent1: The potentiations of the medicine increased its strength.
meanings.sent2: The potentiations of the fertilizer improved the plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The chef's potentiations of the spices made the dish irresistible.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the potentiations of brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The potentiations of the storm made it more destructive.

meanings.definition: The process of increasing the effectiveness of something.
meanings.sent1: Through potentiations, the team improved their performance.
meanings.sent2: The potentiations of the training program boosted productivity.
meanings.sent3: The magician's potentiations of his tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The potentiations of the marketing strategy led to increased sales.
meanings.sent5: The potentiations of the remedy sped up the healing process.

meanings.definition: The result of enhancing the strength or impact of something.
meanings.sent1: The potentiations of the workout regimen showed in his muscles.
meanings.sent2: The potentiations of the speech captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The artist's potentiations of colors created a vibrant painting.
meanings.sent4: The potentiations of the technology revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent5: The potentiations of the idea made it more convincing.
